author: joeyaiello
body:
<!--

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](../docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](../docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Import-Module CimCmdlets
Get-Command -Module CimCmdlets *BinaryMiLog
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
CommandType     Name                                               Version    Source
-----------     ----                                               -------    ------
Cmdlet          Export-BinaryMiLog                                 1.0.0.0    cimcmdlets
Cmdlet          Import-BinaryMiLog                                 1.0.0.0    cimcmdlets
```

Actual behavior
---------------

Nothing is returned.

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16264
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Dupe of #1484

 Must've spelled it wrong when I searched for other issues on this.

title: Export/Import-BinaryMiLog cmdlets are missing on Windows
